text: hi guys it's Elise and welcome back to
another spooky Halloween edition of my
cupcake addiction today only going to be
making some really cool exploding jello
filled chocolate spiders if you want to
see what my makeup was done I will leave
a link down below Bridget from idolized
makeup was lovely enough to complete
this skull candy skeleton look for me so
make sure you check her out if you're
looking for some really really cool
Halloween ideas she has tons of stuff
special effects gory makeup and keeps
acute stuff too let's get started to
make much spooky spider pops I used a
silicone cake pop Bowl but you could
also use a flexible spherical chocolate
mold or an ice cube mold I've got some
baking paper and some melted black candy
melts I also use some dark chocolate to
make a couple of my other spiders over
here so it's up to you what you want to
use there I've got a pair of scissors
and I've got a spoon and there's
material just some tiny little red
sprinkles called nonpareils I'm using
some Maltesers which is similar to
whoppers and I've got a meter of
licorice or licorice strap a little bit
of condensed milk and of course I've got
some green jelly or jello first up I'm
making up my jelly or my jello as per
the manufacturer's instructions
but I'm only adding half of the required
amount of boiling water to this so INGOs
about 100 or 125 mils of boiling water
and then I'm gonna stir it until it's
really really nicely dissolved but once
it's really nicely dissolved I'm gonna
chuck it a couple of ice cubes just to
cool it down really rapidly so we don't
have to wait as long I'm putting in like
three large ice cubes and then I'm gonna
stir through some of that condensed milk
now there's no exact measurement here I
used about two tablespoons of the
condensed milk stir it all the way stir
and that's gonna give you more of like
this slimy jello color then that really
kind of dark green jelly color you can
say your jelly aside and then you want
to take your melted candy melts your
dark chocolate and I'm gonna put about a
half a teaspoon in each of my little
silicone cake pop mold cavities use the
back of your spoon to drag that
chocolate right up the
sighs so that it comes right the way up
to the edges and then you want to pop
those off into the fridge to set we're
gonna do two coats here so don't worry
if this first coat isn't perfect when
the first coats all set you want to
repeat the process exactly the same so
you're giving it two thin coats make
sure you're not going to thicker because
you don't want those chocolate shells to
be too hard for people to actually get
through when they go to eat these before
these ones go into set just use your
finger or clean tissue just to neaten up
the edges and make them as flat as
possible when they come out they should
be really nice and firm and you're going
to need to sort of pop them out of those
silicone molds this is where the middle
ones don't work so well pop them back
into the mold for support and then
you'll want to fill them with your green
jello mix now that makes should be
completely cool and you don't want to
fill them all the way to the brim just
sort of about two-thirds full pop those
back off into the fridge and let that
jelly or jello completely set once your
jello is totally set take one half of
one of your spheres and you just want to
sort of dip it into those melted candy
melts make sure your candy melts are not
super hot here they should be melted but
not burning hot and then take one of
your other halves of your spheres and
you're gonna join the two together once
they're joined together you'll need to
just run your finger around that seam
which will help distribute the chocolate
really nice and evenly and it'll smooth
it out beautifully now it's time to
start building our fighters so cut off a
nice section of your licorice strap you
can also use something here like Haribo
wheels but I'm just going to cut that
licorice strap into eight individual
pieces for each of the legs
you'll also need to cut just two tiny
little triangles for your little spider
fangs of one of your off cuts of
liquorice now I'm gonna use two clean
fresh tissues here and I'm just folding
them in half and then kind of rolling
them into a little bit of a tube this is
gonna be just to support the legs of my
spiders because I found otherwise they
fell over what they were drying and I
had to sit there with my hands
supporting them for ages take your wax
paper now and place down one of your
tubes and then you just want to take a
nice little blob of that black candy
melt don't make this too big you want it
to be a little bit bigger than the base
of your large ball but not too much
because you don't want a really big
black foot underneath take one of your
little jello filled balls now and place
it down
on to that chocolate circle and then you
want to place your other little piece of
tubing on the other side and you're
going to attach your legs now the legs
should have just enough of that candy
mount pocono underneath the sphere to be
able to stick straight into that candy
melt that you've put down onto the
baking paper and then just kind of hang
them out over the sides of the tissue
and that's just going to give them
something to support them on while
they're drying and let them keep their
lovely round shape for my spiders head
today I'm using a malteaser
or any round brown candy will do I'm
gonna dip that into a small amount of my
black candy melt and then I'm just going
to roll that very small dip section into
some of my little red nonpareils this is
gonna look like a whole bunch of little
tiny red eyes on your spiders head and
then you want to take your toothpick
with another two small dots of that
black candy mount and use that to glue
on your two little triangular fangs
there's your little head ready to stick
on to stick that one down you're gonna
take more of that black candy melt and
you need to bring it right up the back
and also the base so the red eyes should
be sort of on top of his head the fangs
should be facing forward and there
should be enough of that chocolate to
support the base on the wax paper and to
stick the back of that malteaser onto
that spherical ball once he's all set
remove the tissues and your spiders
ready to serve
I recommend storing these in the fridge
until about an hour to before you want
to serve them and when you serve them I
like to surprise my guests by not
telling them about that jello Center
because it's great to see their faces
when they reach that green goo inside I
hope you guys will enjoy recreating this
gruesome Halloween treat for your
friends and family and make sure that
you don't forget to check out Brigid
from idolize make up for all of your
Halloween and Beyond makeup ideas now it
seems I've got a slight spider problem
in my kitchen not anymore
happy Halloween
